sentences.en: David was desolated by his wife’s death.
sentences.cn: 妻子的死使戴维悲痛万分。

sentences.en: He looked at them with a smile both acrid and desolate.
sentences.cn: 他带着辛辣、凄凉的微笑看着他们.

sentences.en: Numerous factories have sprung up in this once desolate area.
sentences.cn: 过去这一带满目苍凉,现在却有了无数的工厂.

sentences.en: Over all the desolate place there hung a still and awful calm.
sentences.cn: 这儿整个偏僻的地方笼罩着一种可怕的寂静.

sentences.en: She did not understand how desolate her life would be without him.
sentences.cn: 她不知道一旦离开了他,她的生活将会多么孤单.

sentences.en: She recognized the country more precisely, the desolate marsh and the sea.
sentences.cn: 她对乡村景色的辩认更细致入微了, 她看见了那片荒凉的沼泽地和海.

sentences.en: She should be desolate, broken hearted, ready to scream at fate.
sentences.cn: 她本该感到凄凉, 伤心, 发出绝望的喊叫.

sentences.en: She thought of her own desolate fate, far from her native land.
sentences.cn: 她想到自己孤寂的命运, 远离自己的国土.

sentences.en: She was back at Tara again and Tara was desolate.
sentences.cn: 她梦见自己又回到了塔拉,而塔拉是一片荒凉.

sentences.en: The church was small and desolate in the early morning sunlight.
sentences.cn: 教堂很小,在清晨的阳光下显得很冷清.

sentences.en: The city was burnt to a desolate waste.
The house was desolate, ready to be torn down.
sentences.cn: 这房子没人居住, 等着拆除.

sentences.en: The little children were left desolate.
sentences.cn: 孩子们被抛下无人照管.

sentences.en: The planting of winter and spring-flowering bulbs will supply colourful decoration at a time when most gardens are looking fairly desolate.
sentences.cn: 栽种冬春季节开花的鳞茎植物可以在大多数花园看上去还比较萧索的时候提供多彩的装点。

sentences.en: The town has a desolate visage.
sentences.cn: 这个镇子呈现出一片荒凉.

trans.tran_en: (of a place) empty and without people, making you feel sad or frightened
to make someone feel very sad and lonely
